name: Millennium Bailey's Hotel London Kensington

reviews.text: Two of us stayed two nights at the Millennium Bailey's Hotel, each in our own single room and overall it was a positive experience. The location of the hotel, especially being across the street from the Tube station is great. There are lots of restaurants and shops in the area as well. The single rooms are very small, but they were nicely decorated and comfortable. The rooms were also nicely eqipped, minibar, ironing board, etc. Staff were friendly. The rate for a London hotel was reasonable. On the downside my room, at least, showed some signs of neglect. The only shelf in the bathroom was a glass shelf that lacked, well, glass. This made it's utility as a shelf nonexistent. Notifying the desk did not produce a shelf during my stay. A cupboard door lacked a knob, and an electric outlet appeared to be damaged. Except for the shelf none of these things was an inconvenience, but they were noticeable in a hotel with somewhat elegant pretensions. We ate at "Olives," one of the hotel's restaurants. The decor was nice and the food was very good. It was also very expensive, perhaps a bit more expensive than either the food or decor merited. Overall it was a comfortable place at a reasonable price (dinner aside) to stay for a couple nights on a nontourist trip. Given the location I'd would recommend the hotel, but suggest modest expectations.
reviews.title: Good, could be better

likes.disliked: — A bit battered around the edges

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have just returned from a stay here for the weekend. The location is excellent. Walk out of the tube station and there you are. The hotel itself is really nice and our room was of a good size with a wonderfullty comfortable King size bed. The hotel is quite expensive but then you are paying for location but equally there are deals to be had if you do not book with the hotel directly (we used hotels.com) Breakfast was included for us and the breakfast was good but if you are paying for it then you would be better off eating outside the hotel as it is expensive. As with all London hotels the drinks in the bar are very expensive, this hotel has a pub just opposite which is about half the price of the hotel for a sprit and mixer £8 in the hotel, £3.50 in the pub. The hotel bar is very nice though and if you want a quiet drink with no crowds then paying the extra may be worth it to you.
reviews.title: Good hotel

likes.disliked: — The unfriendleness of some check in and bar staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall a great hotel which was only let down by some staff who although not rude could not be excused of being friendly.
reviews.title: Just "ok" hotel

reviews.text: It was a good hotel but not great. The staff were really nice and helpful except the room service staff was a bit rude. The room was old, the bathroom floor were craking, some of them even broken. The floor in the room made lots of noise when we walked because it was old wooden floor. Our room's heater was broken and got fixed. Overall It was ok room, if you stay only couple of days, but I would not book this hotel again in the future just because the room is so old. They really need renovation for the hotel.
reviews.title: Stay in London a lot for work and this is one of my favorite

reviews.text: I probably stay in a London hotel every couple of weeks for work and sometimes pleasure, and this hotel is one of my all time favorites (I have a short list of about 6, and a very long long list of not so good places).
reviews.title: Excellent hotel
Nice Hotel in a nice area
reviews.text: I've stayed in this hotel with my boyfriend for one night just before the Xmas Holidays. It was his first London Trip and we really enjoyed it. The Reception was decorated with a beautiful Xmas Tree. I have to say that we really enjoyed it although the bathroom was not really like I imagine for a 4 stars Hotel. The Room was very clean. We had a lovely breakfast in the main living room. Regarding the location, it's a little bit far from the Center of London but quite close to the Natural Museum and Harrods but still quite near if you use the Tube (the Metro Station is just in front of the hotel). It is still a nice hotel in a quiet area of London. The staff was very professional, kind and nice. In conclusion I would recommend it ..... Well if you go there ENJOY .... Cheers ... C.

Last spring I achieved a life-long goal of going to London. It was a last-minute decision so I was understandably nervous booking a hotel and knowing nothing about it. The hotel is in a perfect location (right next to a tube station AND across the street from Starbuck's and Paul's, a wonderful French bakery - line up early for your breakfast pastry), and the hotel staff could not have been more pleasant, polite or helpful. The room was so clean that there wasn't even any dirt in the corners on the bathroom floor - you can't say that about most hotels in the U.S. You can ride the tube or walk to places like the Victoria and Albert Museum, Harrod's, Hyde Park, and Kensington Palace.
reviews.title: Spotless Hotel; Great Service!

likes.liked: — Great location, cleanliness, friendly and helpful staff
likes.disliked: — Not wheelchair-accessible. Was by myself, but my husband, who uses a chair, wouldn't have been able to access the building because of the steps out front.

reviews.text: I was so pleased with this hotel that I'll be staying here again for a week in March, 2007.
reviews.title: Loved Bailey's Millennium

likes.liked: — Clean, friendly, convenient to Underground, restaurants, parks, shopping.

reviews.text: Bailey's Millennium is perfectly located. There are numerous restaurants nearby, as well as the British Musuem and Kensington/Hyde Parks. The rooms are immaculate, the staff very friendly and helpful, and ammenities such as coffee/tea service in the room very helpful.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money

reviews.text: The breakfast is excellent, as well as the on-site restaurant.
reviews.title: Extremely useful staff, clean and reliable hotel with charm

likes.disliked: — Some of the rooms are noisy and tiny but most are good. Ask staff for upgrade or for room change if you were unlucky and they will help if they have opportunity

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arrival we were greeted and offered a glass of mulled wine, this was late December so coming in from the cold,this was much appreciated,a really warm welcome.
reviews.title: superb

likes.disliked: — the scary staircase....if you have tiny kids,keep an eye on them and take the elevator!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The receptionist muttered something about taking our visa number in case we wanted any addons,which we didn't completely understand,as we normally pay after we have bought something and are satisfied with it,but she didn't venture to explain,rather told us to forget about it.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in excellent location

reviews.text: We thought the lobby was beautiful,huge Christmas tree etc. really nice.So we lugged our bags into the elevator and up to the second floor.The place was spotlessly clean,we noticed on the suprisingly long hike to our room.Upon arrival we found the room to be very nice,spacious and clean.The bed had no duvet,as seems to be the norm these days,so we were slightly concerned about the coldness of the room and the aircon didn't seem to work.The bathroom was also clean but had a slightly wierd plumbing system(the shower head was weak but the second one attached to the taps was great,but had no holder)
reviews.title: Great concierge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This would be fine if you could have bath,but the bath had some kind of rough pads so you wouldn't slip in the shower,and these pads were a bit mucky,so I didn't really want to sit on them.Anyways,to have a good shower you had to hold the best shower head in one hand and clean yourself with the other,not impossible but a little awkward.(picky...moi?)
reviews.title: Good Position bit dissapointing

likes.disliked: — rooms very noisy and dark room service awfull

reviews.text: So on our way out,I mentioned our room was a little cold and we couldn't work out the heating system,and the man said he would look into it.
reviews.title: Great Pre-Christmas Stay at Bailey's

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a two night trip to London. We went just to see some of the museums which we hadn't seen for years so location was the key factor. Hotel was reasonable but the room was very small and as one other review mentioned, lights were needed at any time of the day. The rooms were spotlessly clean but in need of care and attention as far as repairs and decoration were concerned. Having said all of this, the location was great, right opposite the tube station and within easy walking distance of a lot of the museums. The reception staff were helpful and as we stayed a Friday and Saturday night advised us not to pay for two nights parking next door at the Millenium Gloucester but to park outside from 1.30 on the Saturday as it was free from that time until Monday at 8.oo a.m. This saved us £30 in parking fees. Cafe/Restaurant opposite the tube station is great for breakfast and very cheap compared to the hotel. Good restaurants nearby are Bugis St (part of the Millenium Gloucester) which is Singapore/Chinese and a good Italian at the top of Gloucester Rd. OK the hotel is not brilliant but not bad for the money but location is great
reviews.title: Not the best but great location

reviews.text: My husband and I recently stayed for five nights at the Millenium Bailey's hotel. It was our first trip to London and though it's a three-plus star hotel, we understood that the European rating system is somewhat different than the US.
reviews.title: A decent but somewhat disappointing hotel

reviews.text: The location was right across the street from the Gloucester Rd Underground station -which was very convenient! However, we were disappointed by the lack of quality restaurants in the area. And in hindsight might have been better situated in the Notting Hill neighborhood for its character and charm.
reviews.title: Great Stay
Location location location
reviews.text: The room itself was small, but large enough for two people. The bed was comfortable and the air conditioning worked great, as did the filter to make it a non-smoking room. The room was cleaned and tidied every day, and the room safe was secure. Additionally, we arrived early and they were able to provide us with a room. The glaring negative of the room was the bathroom...the shower curtain did not wrap all the way around the tub/shower and it was impossible to avoid drenching the entire bathroom. Also, the tub shower was set so high it was difficult to get into, and the feature of a heated towel rack that could not be turned off made it a dangerous combination! ouch! Also, while we were able to check in early the bathroom was not well-cleaned.

reviews.title: Bailey Millenium; Value and location
reviews.text: The staff is courteous, but not very friendly. We typically like to take advantage of the expertise of hotel concierge, but found the staff unhelpful in identifying restaurants and insider tips.

description: The Millennium Bailey's HotelThis Central London hotel is a magnificently restored Victorian townhouse situated in the heart of Kensington. From the moment you enter our stately hall, the authentic Victorian decor envelops you and it also retains much of its Victorian heritage with its sweeping staircases and real fireplaces. Located opposite Gloucester Road Underground Station, the hotel is well-situated for visiting many of London’s greatest attractions, including Hyde Park, Natural History, Science and Victoria & Albert Museums.
